name: Communicating Intent in Code with HashNotAdam
description: HashNotAdam guides us through the art of writing code that speaks your intent and avoids common pitfalls, drawing from real Rails experience.

talks.title: The Unspoken Contract: Communicating Intent Through Code
talks.description: Discover the secrets of writing code that communicates your intent! Learn from a real Rails bug why naming, structure, and clear boundaries matter. Ideal for devs who want their code to speak‚Äîloud and clear. Join HashNotAdam for practical tips and relatable war stories!

name: Task Runners with Michael Milewski & Rails 8 with John Sherwood
description: Explore task runners with Michael Milewski, then get hands-on with Rails 8 in production with John Sherwood! Two practical talks to supercharge your dev workflow.

talks.title: Make vs Justfile vs Mise
talks.description: Choosing the perfect task runner? Michael Milewski breaks down Make, Justfile, Mise, and more. Discover best practices, playbooks, and how far Developer Infrastructure as Code can go. Don‚Äôt miss this practical, energetic tour of modern task runners!

talks.title: rails 8 new
talks.description: Join John Sherwood as he shares lessons from building a production app on Rails 8! Learn the ins, outs, and happy surprises of Rails 8 with Kamal, Action Cable, Active Job, and more. Bring your questions‚Äîit‚Äôs interactive and fun!

name: Mastering Turbo Forms with Matt Hood and SQLite in Ruby with Simon Hildebrandt
description: Join Matt Hood as he unravels Turbo form wizardry and Simon Hildebrandt delves into using SQLite as a Ruby gem. Insightful, interactive, and fun!

talks.title: How on earth do you manage forms with Turbo?
talks.description: Get the inside scoop on taming tricky Turbo forms! Matt Hood shares hands-on tips and fun tricks for error handling, validation, and making forms a breeze. Perfect for anyone wanting smoother Rails forms. üöÄ

talks.title: SQLite-ruby - a whole SQL database in a gem
talks.description: Discover the wonders of SQLite wrapped neatly in a Ruby gem! Simon Hildebrandt introduces SQLite-ruby‚Äîfast, familiar, and a little bit magical. Bring your questions and curiosity!

name: Business Logic Objects Panel & Rack Fundamentals with Julian, Adam, Simon
description: Dive into advanced Ruby business logic structures in a lively panel with Julian Pinzon and Adam, then get hands-on with Rack‚Äôs fundamentals with Simon Hildebrandt.

talks.title: Panel/Discussion/Riffing Session on Objects to encapsulate business logic
talks.description: Join Julian Pinzon and Adam for a lively panel on modern ways to organize business logic in Ruby apps. Discover practical tips, fresh perspectives, and get your questions answered. Don't miss this spirited session full of insight and laughs!

talks.title: Rack Fundamentals revisited
talks.description: Simon Hildebrandt revisits the Rack layer under Ruby‚Äôs most popular web frameworks. Learn the core mechanics and find out when you don‚Äôt need Rails! Perfect for Rubyists looking to level-up their backend game.

name: Semantic Search and RAG with Ruby by Daniel Kaminsky
description: Explore smart search systems in Ruby! Daniel Kaminsky breaks down embeddings, RAG, and more.

talks.title: Semantic Search and RAG with Ruby
talks.description: Curious about modern smart search? Join us as Daniel Kaminsky walks through building a powerful semantic search system with Ruby, from embeddings to Retrieval Augmented Generation. Perfect for those interested in the cutting edge of search tech!

name: Puma Internals with Joshua and Ruby 3.4/Rails 8 Salad by Anton
description: Explore Puma‚Äôs secrets with Joshua and get the tasty highlights of Ruby 3.4 & Rails 8 with Anton.

talks.title: The Inner Workings of Puma
talks.description: Ever wondered what makes Puma tick? Joshua Yeo guides us deep inside Puma‚Äôs design and advanced features. Ideal for Rubyists who want to level up their server game and understand performance secrets up close!

talks.title: Ruby salad. What's fresh on the market?
talks.description: Join Anton for a flavourful tour of Ruby 3.4 and Rails 8‚Äôs freshest features! If you love seeing new ruby and rails goodness in action‚Äîincluding authentication generators and Rodauth vs Rails Auth‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss this bite-sized update.

name: Cursor v Copilot with Ceels & Happy Ruby SAML by Pat
description: Join us for an AI coding showdown with Ceels and dive into practical SAML magic for Ruby with Pat!

talks.title: Cursor v Github Copilot: building a better data schema tool?
talks.description: Ceels puts Cursor and Copilot head to head! Get tips for setting up Cursor, explore its AI model options, and discover which tool fits your workflow best. Bring your questions and see these coding copilots in action!

talks.title: Happy Ruby SAML Development
talks.description: Pat guides you through tackling real-world SAML authentication in Ruby‚Äîno mocking, just hands-on SSO, fast Nokogiri parsing, and multi-domain setups the Covidence way. Learn how to smooth out your SAML experience!

name: Hotwire Happiness with Jero Paul & Rails CurrentAttributes with Darkfishy
description: Dive into frontend joy with Jero Paul on Hotwire, Turbo & Stimulus. Then, uncover the magic of Rails `CurrentAttributes` with Darkfishy.

talks.title: Turbo (Hotwire), Stimulusjs and being happy with front end development again
talks.description: Rediscover the joy of frontend dev! Jero Paul shares his Hotwire, Turbo, and Stimulus journey‚Äîgreat for anyone ready to love building apps again üöÄ. Come see why modern Rails tools spark happiness!

talks.title: How do `CurrentAttributes` work?
talks.description: Ever wondered how Rails keeps track of values per request? Darkfishy explains `ActiveSupport::CurrentAttributes`, request isolation, and more in an engaging and practical talk. Perfect for Rails developers seeking backend clarity!

name: Understanding reload! in Rails with Darkfishy & Oaken Seeds by Julian Pinzon
description: Discover the magic behind Rails' reload! with Darkfishy and get a fresh take on seeds and fixtures with Julian Pinzon.

talks.title: How does `reload!` work?
talks.description: Curious about what happens when you hit `reload!` in the Rails console? Join Darkfishy as we peek under the hood and reveal how Rails reloads code, what classes are affected, and the impacts on your dev workflow. Rails magic, demystified!

talks.title: Oaken - A fresh take on seeds and fixtures
talks.description: Step up your data game! Join Julian Pinzon as he explores Oaken, a new way to handle seeds and fixtures in Rails. Discover efficient methods, best practices, and why Oaken could become your go-to for dev data. Fresh ideas guaranteed!

name: Career Change Inspiration with Helen Stonehouse & Rails Engines with Chris Oliver
description: Hear Helen Stonehouse‚Äôs journey into tech and get hands-on with Rails Engines in a fun double bill with Chris Oliver.

talks.title: My Career Change - Nothing is what it seems
talks.description: Helen Stonehouse shares her inspiring journey into tech, filled with relatable anecdotes and encouragement to take the leap. Perfect for anyone pondering a career shift or just looking for a dose of motivation!

talks.title: Rails Engines in 20 minutes
talks.description: Curious how to extend Rails? Chris Oliver will walk you through building plugins and using Engines. Join us for a practical, speedy deep dive‚Äîperfect for devs wanting to level up their Rails skills!

name: Pinkest Pink with Dan Laush & Allyship with Nick Wolf
description: Dive into vibrant web colors with Dan Laush and learn about being a good male ally with Nick Wolf.

talks.title: Pinkest Pink
talks.description: Explore the web‚Äôs newest, brightest colors! Dan Laush shares how our eyes see color and how we recreate vibrant realities on screens. Join us for a colorful and fun talk that will make you see web colors in a whole new light!

talks.title: Being a Good Male Ally
talks.description: Nick Wolf guides us through what it means to be a supportive male ally. Join his insightful talk and foster a more inclusive, positive environment for everyone. Practical tips and genuine stories included!

name: Rebuilding Products with Prakriti Mateti & Turbo in Laravel with Simran Sawhney
description: Join Prakriti Mateti as she shares insights on rebuilding a large product from scratch, plus discover Turbo in Laravel with Simran Sawhney.

talks.title: One does not simply... rebuild a product
talks.description: Thinking of rebuilding a big product? Join Prakriti Mateti as she takes you through the highs, lows, and lessons of rebuilding Culture Amp's second biggest platform! Great for anyone facing tough legacy code and tech debt. üç∞

talks.title: Laravel, meet my friend Turbo
talks.description: Simran Sawhney shows how Turbo can spice up your Laravel projects! Get the scoop on Turbo, Turbo Native, and Strada, and see how they compare with Livewire. Perfect for Rubyists curious about the PHP world!

name: Understanding Cursors: Modern Pagination Approaches in Ruby
description: Explore why cursor-based pagination trumps traditional pagination in Ruby‚Äîstaving off data staleness and powering GraphQL and more. Perfect for anyone moving beyond standard page-by-page queries!

talks.title: Cursors: Why Pagination is Bad-gination!
talks.description: Don't let your data get stale! Dive into modern cursor-based pagination with Ruby and see why it's taking over GraphQL and beyond. You'll learn new ways to keep your info fresh, fast, and reliable. Pagination will never look the same again! ‚ö°

name: Dissecting Rails with Anthony Chen
description: Join Anthony Chen as he shares his dive into Rails internals‚ÄîActive Support, Active Model, and more‚Äîfrom his learning journey. Perfect for curious Rubyists!

talks.title: Dissecting Rails
talks.description: Explore Anthony Chen's hands-on takeaways from dissecting Rails internals! Learn about Active Support, Active Model, and get insights to fuel your Rails journey. Great for learners and fans of Ruby alike! üöÄ

name: One Billion Rows in Ruby with Rian McGuire & Ruby Economics by Ponny
description: Explore CPU crunching in Ruby with Rian McGuire and discover the economics behind the Ruby ecosystem with Ponny. Insights, techniques, and fun for every Rubyist!

talks.title: One Billion Rows in Ruby
talks.description: Find out if Ruby can tackle serious data crunching! Rian McGuire dives into the One Billion Row Challenge, optimizing Ruby to the max. Perfect for anyone who wants to push Ruby‚Äôs limits. Don‚Äôt miss this adventure in code and speed!

talks.title: The Economics of Ruby
talks.description: Ruby plus economics‚Äîwhat's not to love? Ponny gives a rapid-fire talk on the flow of resources, incentives, and the unsung heroes powering the Ruby world. Get a fresh perspective on what keeps our community ticking!

name: Self-hosting Rails with Saramic & Scaling Systems with Stefanus Wilfrid
description: Explore how to host a Rails app from home with Saramic and master scaling basics of distributed systems with Stefanus Wilfrid.

talks.title: Can I host a rails app from a home server?
talks.description: Curious about running Rails from your own home? Saramic explores self-hosting, cost savings, DevOps fun, and why DIY deployment rocks. Come see how far you can go with bare metal! üíª

talks.title: System Design & Distributed System Lightweight Concept
talks.description: Join Stefanus Wilfrid for a practical session on scaling your app! Learn lightweight strategies for vertical/horizontal scaling and get hands-on tips for taming distributed systems. üöÄ

name: DMARC Reports with HashNotAdam & Ruby Fibers with KJ Tsanaktsidis
description: Discover how to process DMARC reports with Action Mailbox, then take a deep dive into the internals of Ruby fibers with KJ!

talks.title: Processing DMARC reports via Action Mailbox
talks.description: Curious about DMARC reports? See how HashNotAdam automates parsing and alerts with Action Mailbox! Perfect if you want less spam and clearer email deliverability insights‚Äîall using Ruby on Rails. Join us for email geekery made simple and fun!

talks.title: Something Something Fibers Something
talks.description: Dive into Ruby's fiber internals with KJ Tsanaktsidis! Unpack how Fiber.yield and resume work, how fibers relate to threads, and discover their awesome low-level magic. Perfect for Rubyists who love digging into the guts of the language!

name: Developer Wisdom with Justin Towsey & Rails Engines Discussion with Anton Valkov
description: Join Justin Towsey for lessons and wisdom from a year as a dev, then dive into Rails architecture and engines with Anton Valkov in a panel-style discussion.

talks.title: Precious gems I've learned during my first dev year
talks.description: Reflect on a year packed with developer discoveries! Justin shares his top nuggets of wisdom and inspiring moments from his first year in tech. Perfect for new and seasoned devs alike to learn, laugh, and relate.

talks.title: Rails architecture with engines work group
talks.description: Explore the power of Rails Engines! Anton will demo his app and kick off a group discussion on architecture best practices, sharing stories and real-world examples. Great for anyone curious about modular Rails apps.

name: Bootcamp Project Showcase by Thomas Hoang & Env Var Insights by Michael S.
description: Dive into full stack creativity with Thomas Hoang's bootcamp project and level-up your Rails security with Michael S.'s talk on environment variables.

talks.title: Showcase of final project of my bootcamp with Academy Xi
talks.description: Celebrate creativity! Join Thomas Hoang as he presents his full stack web app‚Äîcrafted from Rails and React‚Äîdeveloped for his final Academy Xi bootcamp project. Get inspired by a real-world journey from learning to launch!

talks.title: Thoughts on Environment Variables
talks.description: Learn the do's and don'ts of environment variables in Rails with Michael S.! Discover best practices for secrets, safe config storage, and tools to keep your apps secure. See real code and real solutions in this punchy lightning talk!

name: Rails Forms with Anton and Power of Pair Presenting by Simran
description: Anton shares quick insights on Rails forms, then Simran explores how pair presenting can make your talks unforgettable!

talks.title: Rails forms
talks.description: Join Anton for a fast-paced lightning talk on Rails forms and service objects! Perfect for anyone looking to streamline form handling in their Rails app. Short, sharp, and super practical‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss it!

talks.title: Unleashing the Power of Pair Presenting: Elevate Your Conference Impact
talks.description: Simran reveals how pair presenting can transform your conference talks! Explore the benefits, pitfalls, and exciting live demos while learning to forge deeper connections and make every presentation memorable.

name: Game Dev with Map7 and Ruby Code Dive with Rian McGuire
description: Hear Map7 share insights from building a 2D action game in Dragonruby, plus take a deep dive into Ruby code internals with Rian McGuire.

talks.title: Dragonruby: Creating the game "Metal Warrior: Search for Valhalla"
talks.description: Hear Map7 share fun stories, highlights, and hurdles from building their action-packed 2D game in Dragonruby. Aspiring game devs and curious coders‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss this energetic lightning talk!

talks.title: But why does it work?
talks.description: Nothing‚Äôs a black box! Rian McGuire will show you how to confidently peer into unfamiliar code and languages, exploring gems and even the Ruby source. Demystify how things really tick in this inspiring talk.

name: Guidance for Juniors, Bug Mysteries & FHIR with Michael, radar, Matt Hood
description: Mentorship and TDD tips for juniors, unraveling a 27-year-old production bug with radar, and Matt Hood delves into FHIR's technical power in healthcare.

talks.title: Tips for juniors and mentors
talks.description: Join Michael as he shares uplifting tips for juniors and mentors! Learn about pairing up in the community, brushing up Ruby with exercism, and taking your TDD and dojo skills to the next level. A quick, friendly guide for all newcomers.

talks.title: A production bug 27 years in the making
talks.description: Get ready for a suspenseful bug hunt! radar unveils the story of a perfectly-tested app with a bug that lay dormant for 27 years. Learn from surprising production adventures. You‚Äôll laugh, you‚Äôll gasp, you‚Äôll code more defensively.

talks.title: How FHIR is tackling a wicked problem with technical, social and political solutions
talks.description: Matt Hood explores FHIR‚Äîhow it‚Äôs revolutionizing healthcare data by solving technical, social, and political challenges. Ideal for Ruby devs and anyone curious about interoperability and tech advocacy. Fascinating insights await!

name: Simple I18n with David Carlin and Exercism for Juniors with Achhetr
description: David Carlin shares fresh I18n simplicity tips, followed by Achhetr demoing Exercism and coding approaches for junior devs.

talks.title: Lightning talk: How to stop I18n getting complex
talks.description: Ready to stop wrestling with I18n? David Carlin reveals clever new ways to keep language logic simple in your Rails apps. Clear, concise, and unlike anything you've seen before‚Äîunlock a smoother multilingual workflow!

talks.title: Exercism for Junior Developers
talks.description: Join Achhetr‚Äôs welcoming walkthrough of Exercism! See hands-on coding exercises and gain TDD & pair programming confidence. Perfect for new devs looking for real-world problem-solving tips and a supportive vibe.

name: The Joy of Docs: Technical Writing with Oscar Alan Pierce
description: Join Oscar Alan Pierce as he shares practical tips for better technical writing‚Äîmake your docs fun, clear, and super useful for every developer!

talks.title: The Joy of Docs: Technical Writing for Developers and Engineers
talks.description: Unlock the secrets to writing documentation that actually helps! Join Oscar Alan Pierce for a fun and insightful session on improving your technical writing and making your docs shine. You‚Äôll never look at commit messages the same way again!

name: View Components in the Wild with Vanessa Nimmo
description: See how Vanessa Nimmo and the team at Fresho use View Components to make Rails views simpler, easier to test, and more fun to build!

talks.title: View Components in the Wild
talks.description: See how Fresho uses View Components to make Rails testing and frontend dev wilder, more composable, and a lot more fun! Learn about decomposing UIs and writing maintainable, consistent code.
